Clast comments: Dominant clasts mostly UM , none bigger than 1 cm in size. Highly weathered. Includes rare grey mafic clasts, also less than 1 cm.

General interval comment: Matrix dominantly pale green but with pale orange stain in places; not from uppermost sand layer, but oxidation of the serpentine mud.

General interval comment: Lump of blue mud with variegated texture of greens, blue, and dark blue. Small black clasts of UM rock now clay.

Four small (1-3 cm) pieces of UM rock (harz?). Serpentinized, pseudomorphic. Bastite pseudomorphs apparent in two pieces. Two larger pieces are cut by very thin (0.5 mm to hairline thickness) veins of calcite.
Single piece of serpentinized harzburgite, may contain fresh relics. Pseudomorphic. Thin serpentinite veins and selvages (pale green); no carbonate veins.
Single piece of serpentinized UM rock, harzburgite? Pseudomorphic serpentine.

Single piece of serpentinized harzburgite. Cut by 1 mm thick vein of serpentine (pale green, layered) and network of thin (hairline) veins. Reddish color over the olive green - possible relic minerals.

Four small (2-4 cm) pieces of reddish brown breccia. Clasts are small rounded UM rock fragments, matrix is red-brown siliceous material (does not react with acid). Angular Carbonate fragments (?) 2-3 mm size, not clear if clast or vein material.
Four pieces (1-3 cm) of red-brown microbreccia / conglomerate. Tiny pink and grey clasts in red brown matrix. Matrix siliceous.
Two pieces of fine siltstone with graded beds 5 mm thick. Contacts smooth and slightly curved. Beds in small piece appear to be boudinaged. Metasiltstone perhaps?
Two larger pieces (3 cm) and six 1-cm pieces of microbreccia with UM clasts (to 5-8 mm) in red-brown siliceous matrix. Similar to Piece 6 this core.
Blue-green serpentine mud matrix with area of dark green that is likely a shattered clast of serpentinized UM rock. Matrix concentrated at the upper end of the piece holder.
Domain is UM breccia with subrounded clasts in dark grey-green matrix. Between the serpentine mud matrix (above) and siltstone (below) in piece holder.
Strongly deformed red-brown siltstone with many small veins of carbonate. Forms lower 4 cm of the piece.
